ygData.subject: Re: Petition or Melee vs. Caster damage
ygData.msgSnippet: But the Warrior does have a limiting factor: Stamina.  Once again, I will draw from my experience in wielding broad swords in real life.  After about 3 to 5
ygData.messageBody:
But the Warrior does have a limiting factor: Stamina. Once again, I will
draw from my experience in wielding broad swords in real life. After about
3 to 5 minutes of constant fighting, in 100 lbs. of armor guess what, you
are wiped out and need to rest a bit. Just like the mage has to rest while
dealing out those spells, we warriors should need to rest after fighting in
all that armor and swinging that 3 to 5 lbs. sword around, 9 lbs. in the
case of great swords.

www.adrianempire.org


> -----Original Message-----
> From: Jones, Brian [mailto:brian.jones@...]
> Sent: Friday, June 11, 1999 5:15 AM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Petition or Melee vs. Caster damage
>
>
> From: "Jones, Brian" <brian.jones@...>
>
> Mages have a limit at what they can do though. Sure they can
> hit with a
> spell for 1200 damage, but they have mana that will
> eventually run out. By
> what you are suggesting, a warrior could keep swinging and
> swinging for
> 1200 damage per attack without losing that ability after
> prolonged use (did
> that make sense)? The critical strike is probably a good
> solution, as well
> as the specialization skill - but in no way should a warrior
> be able to do
> as much damage as a caster.
>
> > ----------
> > From: Obergfell, Steven[SMTP:SObergfell@...]
> > Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> > Sent: Thursday, June 10, 1999 4:37 PM
> > To: 'warriors_eq@onelist.com'
> > Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Petition or Melee vs. Caster damage
> >
> > From: "Obergfell, Steven" <SObergfell@...>
> >
> > Sorry, that last email was just too hard to read!!! Here
> it is again in
> > plain text!
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > I think the difference between melee combatants and casters
> magic should
> > be
> > thus: Melee fighters should be able to do just as much
> damage, if not
> > more,
> > whereas a caster may strike from a distance, and strike
> multiple targets
> > with area effect spells.
> >
> > I am the president of a national group that fights with live steel
> > weapons.
> > I've been fighting with long swords, 2-handed swords, axes
> and maces for
> > 10
> > years, and I am very comfortable with just how devastating
> these weapons
> > can
> > be. No matter if you are struck by lightning or are cut in
> 2 by a large
> > axe, you are just as dead!
> >
> > So perhaps the direction we need to seek, and the
> difference between these
> > 2
> > types of characters. melee and caster, is not how much
> damage they do, but
> > how. A caster should be able to reach far away, and strike multiple
> > targets, while the great warrior should only be able to
> strike at one
> > target
> > at a time, but be able to mow them down like wheat.
> >
> > Oh, and if anyone is interested in an organization that
> allow you to wear
> > armor and swing a real blade ( and trust me, it will give
> you a whole new
> > perspective on your RPGing!) check out our website!
> >
> > www.adrianempire.org\
> >
